title: Post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and driving

details.description: You must tell DVLA if you have post-traumatic stress disorder and it affects your driving - download the correct form to let them know
details.body:
You must tell DVLA if you suffer from post traumatic stress syndrome and it affects your driving.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You only need to tell DVLA about your post traumatic stress disorder if it affects your driving. Check with your doctor if you’re not sure.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in the M1 questionnaire and send it to the address on the form.

Download ‘M1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 252KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You only need to tell DVLA about your post traumatic stress disorder if it affects your driving. Check with your doctor if you’re not sure.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in the M1V questionnaire and send it to the address on the form.

Download ‘M1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 243KB)
